turns.model_response:
The term "метод k-ближайших соседей" translates to "K-nearest neighbors method" (简称KNN方法) in English. This is a Supervised Machine Learning algorithm that classifies data points based on their similarity to other data points in the dataset. The core idea of KNN is that if two points are similar, they will be classified into the same category. It works best when the features of the objects can be easily measured and when the decision boundary is smooth.

However, it's important to note that "метод k-ближайших соседей" could potentially refer to a specific variant or optimization of KNN in various contexts, including computational literature where variations might highlight different aspects. In any case, given the translation and common usage in discussions about machine learning algorithms, this is the most plausible interpretation based on available information.

Answer: Метод k-ближайших соседей — это метод вductive-рекомендаций, который использует closest neighbors для классификации данных.
